Summary: Dot of light in night sky (only visible with my 7X50 binoculars) made a right turn instantaneously.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was using my 7X50 binoculars to look for interesting tight groupings of stars. The sky was clear. I saw a dot of light directly overhead moving from west to east and thought it was a satellite. I looked away and realized that I could not see it with my unaided eyes. I did not move from my position. I looked again and the same dot of light was moving to starboard at 90 degrees to the original path. It had gone from an eastward path to a southward path in the time it took me to put down my binoculars and look through them again. I doubled checked with my naked eyes to make sure that I was looking at the same grouping of stars and used my binoculars again. It was still going south. It eventually dropped below the tree line. My feeling was one of amazement. No satellite makes right turns. No high flying jet does that either without traversing an arced path which I would have noticed. I realized that I had seen my first UFO. It was a humbling experience.
